intro: Xanthostemon lateriflorus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandblow, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Xanthostemon lateriflorus is well adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures.
